title: 6000contestrhystanner 3

= **[[[https://scp-wiki.wikidot.com/scp-6013/offset/1| << Return to SCP-6013]]]**

[[div style="border:solid 1px #999999; background:#ccedce; margin: auto; padding:10px; margin-bottom: 10px;"]]
[[=]]
++++ {{**Welcome back, ID @@*****@@-3505.**}}

You have viewed this page: {{**531**}} times.
[[/=]]
[[/div]]

----
[[collapsible show="+ Sulemani Quarantine Log: 17/01/19" hide="- Sulemani Quarantine Log: 17/01/19"]]
----
[[div class="blockquote"]]
= **<Begin Log>**

[Langford lies on her cot, listening to music. She mutters the lyrics and drums along with her fingers.]

[Greer enters the quarantine chamber, balancing two trays of food on one arm. One is piled high with cuts of chicken and fruit slices. She sits against the pane of glass separating Langford's cell from the rest of the room.]

[Greer knocks on the glass.]

**Langford:** Food first or yelling first?

**Greer:** [Aggressive] I swear to fucking God, Hannah, I could wring your neck.

**Langford:** [Whispering] Yelling first.

**Greer:** [Aggressive] Site command says I could have you discharged, and quite frankly, I'm considering it. You could have gotten us all killed with the shit you pulled.

**Langford:** I didn't, though.

**Greer:** [Aggressive, immediately] You don't know that! That may as well have been suicide! //You could already// be //dead, Hannah!//

[Langford sits up. She shifts uncomfortably on the cot.]

**Greer:** [Shouting] You could've caught God-knows-what, or been sliced in half or lost an arm or fucking--

[Greer stops and takes a deep breath.]

**Greer:** You could have gotten hurt. Don't do that again.

**Langford:** I wasn't going to let it hurt us, Greer. You'd have done the same thing.

**Greer:** I just . . .

[Langford gets up and steps towards the glass.]

**Langford:** Hey, if I couldn't get myself killed on purpose, do you really think I could do it on accident?

[Langford makes a gun with her fingers and mimes shooting herself in the temple. She smiles expectantly, but frowns when Greer does not react.]

**Langford:** Bad joke?

[Greer shoves Langford's food tray through the cell's meal slot.]

**Greer:** Just eat.

**Langford:** Are you sure? I could have, like, super cholera.

**Greer:** Ugh.

**Langford:** Just start shitting myself inside out.

**Greer:** [Immediately] Alright, alright.

[The two eat in silence for some time.]
----
**Greer:** You kept your composure really well back there.

[Langford stops eating.]

**Greer:** I'm serious. I don't think I could've done what you did in the moment like that.

**Langford:** I mean I have the experience with Adytite, yeah.

**Greer:** You know what I mean.

[Langford pauses.]

**Langford:** . . . I don't really //do// compliments, Joanne.

[Greer chuckles.]

**Greer:** Okay. Then I couldn't do it because it was too stupid.

**Langford:** Yeah, that's it.

[Greer stands up and turns to leave the room.]

**Greer:** Get well soon, okay? That's an order.

**Langford:** Whatever, bitch. I don't get paid by the hour.

[Greer leaves the room, but pauses in the hallway, holding the door open with one foot.]

**Langford:** [Whispering] Thank you.

[Greer sighs and closes the door.]

= **<End Log>**
[[/div]]
[[/collapsible]]
[[collapsible show="+ Site-82 Casualty Report, 01/01/2019-Present" hide="- Site-82 Casualty Report, 01/01/2019-Present"]]

[[/collapsible]]
[[collapsible show="+ Hadina Journal Entry 17, Pre-Excommunication Scan" hide="- Hadina Journal Entry 17, Pre-Excommunication Scan"]]
----
[[div class="blockquote"]]
Greer's trying to finish some of her own work today. Marking off hazardous parts of SCP-6013, apparently, as if any part of it //isn't// hazardous. She says we shouldn't go anywhere alone, but then leaves us for hours at a time to do stuff like this. I can't stand it.

The whales sound beautiful. When I sleep, I can hear them, and other things. It's nice, in a way, like one of those nature tapes I used to fall asleep to as a kid. I'm not sure I even want it gone.

Soonsaran is getting easier too. It's intuition, I assume. I can't quite explain it. It just feels good to hear Raya talk. Warms up my marrow.

I don't think it should be like this.

My blood's like a river in my ears. The walls hurt. I can feel them through my suit, like they're licking my skin. I feel . . . tiny. Or too big, maybe? Like my //insides// are too big. Like I'm spilling out of myself.

It's stress. Beaumont says it's stress, and Beaumont's the doctor. Command wouldn't approve us to come down here unless it was okay.

Besides, Langford's already struggling and I don't need to make this worse. I'll just draw some more to relax.

Never was much of a talker anyway.
-----

[[collapsible show="+ Sitra Achra Internal Memo: 21/04/2019
[ACCESS RESTRICTED to Sitra Achra Personnel]" hide="- Acknowledged. Credentials Approved."]]
----
[[div style="background: #f2f2c2; border:solid 1px #999999; margin: auto; max-width: 650px; padding:20px; margin-bottom: 10px;"]]
[[=]]
+++ {{**From the Desk of Rosetta Protocol Site Director Isaiah Kamski, Sitra Achra Initiative**}}
[[/=]]

As of this release, you are not to speak to me about Hannah Langford.

My orders are clear. The Rosetta Protocol is not diplomacy, it is not charity and it is most certainly not an act of sentimentality. It is //demolition.// It is //decontamination.// And in such work, there is no sympathy for vermin or broken buildings. SCP-6013 cannot be allowed to live. It exists only on the sufferance of its pilot . . . whether human or not, whether truly alive or not. I don't care what it does or how it thinks, as long as it serves.

Hannah Langford was killed on the //Sulemani//. She is survived by a wife of two years and a nine-month-old son. She died dutifully, valiantly even, in service against the Sarkic threat. There’s nothing left to say.

On the record, I’m wrong. Miss Greer will tell you to correct me, I’m sure. But in my office, in my inbox, on my phone lines, there is no dispute. Site-82 will keep its notes and the Foundation will keep theirs. SCP-6013-A will live, and I won’t hear a thing about it. God willing, neither will anyone else.

Goodbye, Hannah.

Rest in peace.
[[/div]]
[[/collapsible]]
[[collapsible show="+ RP: Translation Log 33, Cycle 2-104" hide="- RP: Translation Log 33, Cycle 2-104"]]
----
[[div class="blockquote"]]
= **<Begin Log>**

**Rosetta Protocol Participant ID 19337-9106:** Report, SCP-6013.

[The pericardium glows green. SCP-6013-A stands stationary at the center of the chamber.] 

**SCP-6013-A:** She’s sleeping. Come back later.

[9106 does not move. SCP-6013-A sighs.]

**SCP-6013-A:** [Deadpan] Raya. Company.

**SCP-6013: Ith voya. Heta gräpaf7 itia. Pertittiäm thurayya.**

[[html]]
<select>
<option selected>Ith</option>
<option>I</option>
<option>We</option>
</select> 
<select>
<option selected>voya</option>
<option>tire/exhaust</option>
<option>drag</option>
<option>fall/collapse</option>
</select> .
<br><br>
<select>
<option selected>Heta</option>
<option>You</option>
<option>They</option>
</select> 
<select>
<option selected>gräpaf</option>
<option>harmony</option>
<option>union</option>
<option>group/collective</option>
<option>faith/congregation</option>
</select>
<select>
<option selected>7</option>
<option>above</option>
<option>below</option>
<option>from</option>
<option>inside</option>
<option>of</option>
<option>outside</option>
<option>until</option>
<option>with</option>
<option>WITHOUT</option>
</select> 
<select>
<option selected>itia</option>
<option>leave</option>
<option>vanish/disappear</option>
<option>die</option>
</select> .
<br><br>
All <select>
<option selected>pertit</option>
<option>crowds/mobs</option>
<option>flocks/herds</option>
<option>--schools (of fish)--</option>
</select>
<select>
<option selected>thurayya</option>
<option>break apart/fragment</option>
<option>split open/crack</option>
<option>shatter/crumble</option>
<option>swarm</option>
</select> .
[[/html]]

**9106:** //As-salāmu ʿalaykunna//,[[span class="fnnum"]].[[/span]][[span class="fncon"]]A formal Arabic greeting. Translates to “peace be upon you.” Subject was later removed from Site-82 for breach of the Rosetta Protocol.[[/span]] Raya. [Nodding] 6013-A.

**SCP-6013-A:** [Immediately] Don’t encourage her.

**SCP-6013:** [Adjusting pronunciation] **//Merh-ahb//,**[[span class="fnnum"]].[[/span]][[span class="fncon"]]Possibly a mispronounced or archaic form of “marhaba,” Arabic for “hello.”[[/span]] **antush. Itia.**

[[html]]
<i>Merh-ahb</i> , <select>
<option selected>antush</option>
<option>person/subject</option>
<option>thing/object</option>
<option>pebble/sand</option>
<option>one (i.e. “someone”)</option>
</select> . <br><br>
<select>
<option selected>Itia</option>
<option>Leave</option>
<option>Vanish/Disappear</option>
<option>Die</option>
</select> .
[[/html]]

**9106:** I’ve been instructed to ask about your manifests, Raya. That is, what you carry inside of you.

**SCP-6013: Ith heta ia yool byla, ia eshal byla. Ith bhektertiäm cera, batravtiäm cera, mayaghtiäm cera.**

</select>

</select> ,

</select>

<option>blood/bile</option>
<option>poisons/venoms</option>
<option>menses/semen</option>
<option>eggs</option>
</select>

</select> .
<br><br>
<select>

</select> all <select>

</select>

<option>--wombs--</option>

[[/html]]

**SCP-6013-A:** She doesn’t intend to cooperate.

**9106:** I see. Would you assist me, then?

[SCP-6013-A glows. Its arms unfurl to the elbows and pulse rapidly with green light.] 

**SCP-6013 and SCP-6013-A:** [In unison] **Heta saran hyoda.**

[[html]]
<select>
<option selected>Heta</option>
<option>You</option>
<option>They</option>
</select> 
<select>
<option selected>saran</option>
<option>words/speeches</option>
<option>incantations</option>
<option>instructions</option>
<option>prayers</option>
</select> 
<select>
<option selected>hyoda</option>
<option>speak/say</option>
<option>throw</option>
<option>spit</option>
</select> .
[[/html]]

**9106:** Tell us the contents of the Lungs, Raya.

[Stones throughout the pericardium rotate and fold in on themselves. The floor recedes, revealing the Shining Lungs embedded meters deep in a complex assembly of bone and muscles.]

**SCP-6013 and SCP-6013-A:** [In unison] **Your ends.**

**9106:** Are they full?

**SCP-6013 and SCP-6013-A:** [In unison] **Are replete, yes no. Beyond measures.**

[SCP-6013-A strains.]

**SCP-6013-A:** [Distressed] She’s . . . lying. One is nearly empty. I don’t know about the other four, she’s—

[The floor of the pericardium suddenly returns to its original shape. SCP-6013-A collapses.]

**SCP-6013-A:** [Weak] She’ll make more. To replace it.

**9106:** How much of her pathogenic load is intact?

**SCP-6013: Ia pief.**

[[html]]
<select>
<option selected>Ia</option>
<option>Yes</option>
<option>No</option>
</select> 
<select>
<option selected>pief</option>
<option>satisfactory</option>
<option>good/acceptable</option>
</select> .
[[/html]]

**SCP-6013-A:** [Immediately] 81 percent. Six times K-class lethal yield.

**9106:** I see. Plateauing, then.

**SCP-6013-A:** She’s bypassing her own filters. I don’t know how to make new ones. I . . .

[SCP-6013-A retches.]

**9106:** I’ll inform site command.

**SCP-6013-A:** [Weak] Tell Kamski he can go fuck himself.

[9106 chuckles.]

**9106:** I’ll leave you two be.

**SCP-6013 and SCP-6013-A:** [In unison] **Good.**

= **<End Log>**

[[div style="border:solid 1px #999999; background:#f0b3b1; margin: auto; padding:20px; margin-bottom: 10px;"]]
[[=]]
+++++ {{**THE FOLLOWING INFORMATION HAS BEEN EXPUNGED FROM FOUNDATION RECORDS IN ACCORDANCE WITH SECURITY MANDATE 6013.RP.7790.**}}
[[/=]]
= **<Begin Log>**

**SCP-6013-A:** You said I get to ask questions.

[[span class="dblock"]]**Kamski**[[/span]]**:** I did, that is true.

**SCP-6013-A:** How long has it been? I . . . I can’t keep track of the days.

[[span class="dblock"]]**Kamski**[[/span]]**:** You contained yourself here 112 days ago.

**SCP-6013-A:** . . . Is Greer alright? Tell me she’s alright, please.

[[span class="dblock"]]**Kamski**[[/span]]**:** Joanne Greer is alive, yes.

[SCP-6013-A’s posture relaxes. It places a hand over its mouth, holding back tears.]

**SCP-6013-A:** [Distressed] She isn’t like me, is she?

[[span class="dblock"]]**Kamski**[[/span]]**:** Contaminated? Not likely. She’s survived quarantine for this long. Perhaps SCP-6013 has no need for new converts.

[[[span class="dblock"]]Kamski[[/span]] shuffles his papers.]

[[span class="dblock"]]**Kamski**[[/span]]**:** Have you found the brain yet?

**SCP-6013-A:** What? No, no.

[[[span class="dblock"]]Kamski[[/span]] scowls.]

**SCP-6013-A:** [Distressed] I told you, it doesn’t work that way. There’s not—

[[span class="dblock"]]**Kamski**[[/span]]**:** [Immediately] I know what you’ve said. I came down here for results, and you’ll give them to me one way or another. If you didn’t find the brain then what else did you do?

[SCP-6013-A leans against the wall and slumps to the floor. It draws its knees in close to itself and hangs its head low.]

**SCP-6013-A:** [Muffled] I want to go home.

[[span class="dblock"]]**Kamski**[[/span]]**:** I can’t allow that.

**SCP-6013 and SCP-6013-A:** [In unison] **I want to go home.**

[[span class="dblock"]]**Kamski**[[/span]]**:** You go home when the leviathan is dead, Langford.

**SCP-6013: Ith kulo-kulo surva. Heta oork7, yool’nuterr. Ith huwanz7. Cupard tsatsa, akaras bhektertiäm.**

<select>

<option>Soft/GENTLE</option>
<option>Kind</option>
<option>Sweet/Salty/Savory</option>
</select> 
<select>
<option selected>tsatsa</option>
<option>move/walk</option>
<option>travel</option>
<option>(go on a) journey</option>
<option>flow/course</option>
</select> , 
<select>
<option selected>akaras</option>
<option>field/pasture</option>
<option>reef/seabed</option>
<option>FLOOR</option>
<option>world</option>
</select> all <select>
<option selected>bhekter</option>
<option>claws/talons</option>
<option>teeth</option>
<option>hooks</option>
<option>beasts/vermin</option>
</select> .
[[/html]]

[[span class="dblock"]]**Kamski**[[/span]]**:** [Aggressive] Hannah—

[A black stone impales the notes in [[span class="dblock"]]Kamski[[/span]]’s hand.] 

**SCP-6013-A: You think you're in charge here, but you're not.**

[The pericardium glows red. Outside SCP-6013, SCP-6013-B1 and B2 orient themselves towards the pericardium and vocalize loud enough that they can be heard over [[span class="dblock"]]Kamski[[/span]]'s personal comms.]

**SCP-6013:** [In SCP-6013-A’s voice] **If I wanted, I could smear you across this fucking ceiling. I could turn your entire fleet into goddamn shrapnel.**

[[[span class="dblock"]]Kamski[[/span]] picks up his papers. He makes a point to show the detonator in his off hand.]

[[span class="dblock"]]**Kamski**[[/span]]**:** You could. Once.

[Hundreds of black stones point towards [[span class="dblock"]]Kamski[[/span]]. He places his thumb on the detonator.]

**SCP-6013:** [In SCP-6013-A’s voice] **If you come down here again, //I will kill you//. I’m not kidding. I'll use you to paint this place.**

[[span class="dblock"]]**Kamski**[[/span]]**:** You haven’t answered my question. 

[Rows of black stones mesh together, sealing the pericardium shut.]

**SCP-6013 and SCP-6013-A:** [In unison] **Get out, get out, get out, get out, get out, GET OUT, GET OUT GET OUT //GETOUTGETOUTGETOUT//**

[[[span class="dblock"]]Kamski[[/span]] turns to leave the chamber.]

[[span class="dblock"]]**Kamski**[[/span]]**:** We’ll pick this up another time. Do not delay me again.

= **<End Log>**

----
[[div style="border:solid 1px #999999; background:#f0b3b1; margin: auto; padding:20px; margin-bottom: 10px;"]]
[[=]]
+++++ {{**THE FOLLOWING INFORMATION HAS BEEN EXPUNGED FROM FOUNDATION RECORDS IN ACCORDANCE WITH SECURITY MANDATE 6013.RP.3505.**}}
[[/=]]
= **<Begin Log>**

**Greer:** Please, try to keep the noise down this time. I can’t keep doing this if you tip them off.

**SCP-6013:** [In SCP-6013-A’s voice] **No promises.**

[SCP-6013-A speaks through SCP-6013 for the remainder of the interaction.]

**Greer:** Are you hungry?

**SCP-6013: I don’t think I need to eat, but I’d love whatever you’ve got.**

[Greer pushes a parchment of smoked salmon through the membrane of the pericardium. SCP-6013-A eats from it throughout the conversation.]

**SCP-6013: Wow.** [Chuckling] **That tastes like shit.**

**Greer:** That’s a delicacy, you know.

**SCP-6013: Yeah, yeah.**

[The two speak passionately for a long while.]
----
**Greer:** [Gentle] You okay? Relatively speaking, I mean.

[SCP-6013-A blinks and stares at the floor.]

**SCP-6013: I feel like I’m spreading apart. I don’t want to be in here anymore.**

**Greer:** [Gentle] I know.

[SCP-6013-A places a hand against the membrane of the pericardium.]

**SCP-6013: I wish you would come down here more.**

**Greer:** I would if I could, hon. I’m saving the time I have left.

[There is a long silence. SCP-6013-A stares at Greer’s tied-off left sleeve.]

**SCP-6013: It’s not because of what we did, is it?**

**Greer:** Hannah . . .

**SCP-6013: Ith yool. Thurayya. Ryratal. Ryratal. Ryratal.**

<option selected>Ith</option>

<option>We</option>
</select> 
<select>
<option selected>yool</option>
<option>treason/traitor</option>
<option>betrayal/sacrilege</option>
<option>cancer</option>
<option>allergy</option>
</select> .
<br><br>
<select>
<option selected>Thurayya</option>
<option>Break apart/Fragment</option>
<option>Split open/Crack</option>
<option>Shatter/Crumble</option>
<option>Swarm</option>
</select> .
<br><br>
<select>
<option selected>Ryratal</option>
<option>Apology</option>
<option>Penance</option>
<option>Forgiveness</option>
</select> . 
<select>
<option selected>Ryratal</option>
<option>Apology</option>
<option>Penance</option>
<option>Forgiveness</option>
</select> . 
<select>
<option selected>Ryratal</option>
<option>Apology</option>
<option>Penance</option>
<option>Forgiveness</option>
</select> .
[[/html]]

[Greer places her hand against SCP-6013-A’s.]

**SCP-6013:** [Distressed] **//I’m so sorry, Joanne//.**

**Greer:** [Gentle] We’ll get this done, together. I know we can do it.

**SCP-6013:** [Distressed] **Do you promise?**

**Greer:** [Whispering] I promise.

[SCP-6013-A cries and tenses its body.]

**Greer:** [Whispering] I promise you, with all my heart.

= **<End Log>**
[[/div]]
[[/collapsible]]
[[collapsible show="+ Letter to Blake Kennedy-Langford" hide="- Acknowledged. Credentials Approved."]]
----
**ADDENDUM:** A dead SCP-6013-B5 instance surfaced at Site-82 eleven months after SCP-6013-A’s voluntary self-containment. Its body contained SCP-6013-A’s journal, dry and perfectly intact, along with an ampule of SCP-6013-B0 with the word “CLEAN” written on one side. No other events of this nature have occurred since.
----
[[div class="blockquote"]]
= **[[[*https://scp-wiki.wikidot.com/scp-6013/offset/4 | If any assistance is required, you may refer to official Rosetta Protocol guidelines at any time. >>]]]**
[[/div]]
[[tabview]]
[[tab SCP-6013-A Journal Entry 218, 21/12/2019 (Front)]]
----
[[div class="page"]]

Hello, love. I hope you had a great Christmas. I’m sorry I couldn’t be there with you to celebrate.
@@ @@
I’m going to be on assignment for quite awhile. [[span class="dblock"]]They say a couple of years, at least. We have a lot of cleanup work before we can finish things. The faster we learn, the faster I can leave. But I’ll be back. I promise you I will.[[/span]] You record everything Damien does, you understand? I’ll catch up when I’m there again.
@@ @@
I still have your ring. [[span class="dblock"]]It keeps me sane, honestly. It’s like you’re down here with me. I know you would be if you could. I'm not sure why Raya's letting me keep the metal I've got; maybe she knows I care. Or she just wants Greer's dog tags as a trophy.[[/span]]
@@ @@
[[span class="dblock"]]Think about what I’m doing like defusing a bomb. If I leave, I can’t keep it from going off. Until we find another way, I have to manage getting rid of all the dangerous parts. It’s easier than I would have expected, actually. Moving stuff in here feels like second nature now. It can be hard to keep track of all at once, but Raya helps.[[/span]]
@@ @@
//Oh//, I didn't explain that, did I? [[span class="dblock"]]The Raya thing.[[/span]] I always forget those kinds of details. Have to triple-check this before I send it. Someone said that to me once.
@@ @@
[[span class="dblock"]]Another thing: when I’m back, I want to try for a child. I don’t know how to explain it to you, but we can now. You’re just going to have to trust me. --Carry shining sickness fugitive serpent defile defile consecrate THAT’S ENOUGH RAYA--[[/span]]
@@ @@
I love you so, so much.
@@ @@
[[span class="dblock"]]When I’m home, and I can get transferred to data entry or something less nightmarish, I’m going to take you here. I know someone who would love to meet you. Several someones, actually. We can sit on the shore and watch the lights together. They’re like nothing you’ve ever seen, I promise you that.[[/span]]
@@ @@
[[span class="dblock"]]I’m going to change the world for all of us, Blake. For you.[[/span]]
@@ @@
[[span class="dblock"]]It will be beautiful.[[/span]]
[[/div]]
----
[[/tab]]
[[tab SCP-6013-A Journal Entry 218, 21/12/2019 (Back)]]

        <div style="text-align: center; color: #2f8761; font-weight: bolder; font-family: 'Jura', sans-serif;" id="text"></div>

            var yn = document.getElementById("yn");

                if (yn.value == "yes") {
                    txtDiv.innerHTML = "<hr>Securing Terminal. Goodbye, Joanne Greer.<hr>";
                    setTimeout(function () { window.top.location.href = "http://scp-wiki.wikidot.com/"; }, 2500);
